p:
Co–Fe oxides have been also proposed in several studies. However, the role of Fe and whether it really improves the catalytic properties of cobalt oxides remain under discussion.
596 The majority of the existing studies on Co–Fe systems highlight the role of edge-sharing CoO 6 octahedra, similarly as in pure CoO
x catalysts. For example, ex situ EXAFS analysis revealed a disordered arrangement of metal-O 6 octahedra as the main structural motif in acid-etched layered double Co–Fe hydroxides.
613 Amorphization and the formation of edge-sharing CoO 6 units under OER conditions were observed also in Ca 2FeCoO 5 perovskite-type catalysts.
614 Good agreement between Co K-edge XANES and EXAFS, and those for a CoOOH reference was observed also in the study of Pb–Co–Fe catalysts.
615
